p.b: Helen had vague memories of the trip she took to China ten years earlier.

questionBody.p: Based on its role in the sentence, what can you tell about the word vague?

simpleChoice.p: The word vague is a noun. It names a place that Helen visited in China.
The word vague is an adverb. It describes how Helen went to China.
The word vague is a verb. It tells what Helen did in China.
The word vague is an adjective. It describes Helen's memories.
